archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: This collection contains two grade reports from Virginia Agricultural and Mechanical College for J. Lawrence Radford.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: J. Lawrence Radford Grade Reports, Ms2009-120 - Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The J. Lawrence Radford Grade Reports were acquired by Special Collections prior to 2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the J. Lawrence Radford Grade Reports commenced and was completed in September 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: J. Lawrence Radford attended the Virginia Agricultural and Mechanical College in the early 1870s. While Radford's enrollment in VAMC can be confirmed as early as 1872, he graduated with a certificate in Agriculture and Mechanics in 1875. Information also exists to suggest that Radford, alongside President Minor, spoke to the 1876 graduating class prior to graduation on August 9th of the same year at an alumni meeting in the Lee Society hall. Also, in a book by Joanne Spiers Moche titled Families of Grace Through 1900: Remembering Radford, Volume 1, Central Depot's three primary farmers are listed, placing a James Lawrence Radford on the top of the list with 1,260 acres of land.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains two Virginia Agricultural and Mechanical College grade reports for J. Lawrence Radford. In both the September 1874 report and the March 1875 report, Radford is marked in his senior year.
